About me

I'm a programmer, musician, and author of “Rails, Angular, Postgres, and Bootstrap”, “The Senior Software Engineer” and “Build Awesome Command-Line Applications in Ruby 2”. I speak frequently at national and regional conferences and spend my days currently as a lead engineer at Stitch Fix. I've written applications in C, Java, Ruby, Scala, and many others, on large and small teams. As a developer, I believe in clean code, making it right, providing a great user experience and using the right tool for the job. As a bass player, I believe in using a pick, locking it down, and ripping off Peter Hook. As an author, I insist on the Oxford Comma, try to avoid semi-colons, and dislike title case.
